briefdescription.para: Instantiates a new instance of the InProcessBus<TAuthenticationToken> class.
Publishes the provided command on the command bus.
Publishes the provided commands on the command bus.

memberdef.definition: virtual TEvent Cqrs.Bus.InProcessBus< TAuthenticationToken >.SendAndWait< TCommand, TEvent >
memberdef.name: SendAndWait< TCommand, TEvent >

briefdescription.para: Sends the provided command and waits for an event of TEvent

parameterdescription.para: The TCommand to send.
If provided, is the IEventReceiver<TAuthenticationToken> that the event is expected to be returned on.

memberdef.definition: virtual TEvent Cqrs.Bus.InProcessBus< TAuthenticationToken >.SendAndWait< TCommand, TEvent >
memberdef.argsstring: (TCommand command, int millisecondsTimeout, IEventReceiver< TAuthenticationToken > eventReceiver=null)
memberdef.name: SendAndWait< TCommand, TEvent >

briefdescription.para: Sends the provided command and waits for an event of TEvent or exits if the specified timeout is expired.

parameterdescription.para: The TCommand to send.
The number of milliseconds to wait, or F:System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite (-1) to wait indefinitely.
If provided, is the IEventReceiver<TAuthenticationToken> that the event is expected to be returned on.

memberdef.definition: virtual TEvent Cqrs.Bus.InProcessBus< TAuthenticationToken >.SendAndWait< TCommand, TEvent >
memberdef.argsstring: (TCommand command, TimeSpan timeout, IEventReceiver< TAuthenticationToken > eventReceiver=null)
memberdef.name: SendAndWait< TCommand, TEvent >

briefdescription.para: Sends the provided command and waits for an event of TEvent or exits if the specified timeout is expired.

parameterdescription.para: The TCommand to send.
A T:System.TimeSpan that represents the number of milliseconds to wait, or a TimeSpan that represents -1 milliseconds to wait indefinitely.
If provided, is the IEventReceiver<TAuthenticationToken> that the event is expected to be returned on.

memberdef.definition: virtual TEvent Cqrs.Bus.InProcessBus< TAuthenticationToken >.SendAndWait< TCommand, TEvent >
memberdef.argsstring: (TCommand command, Func< IEnumerable< IEvent< TAuthenticationToken >>, TEvent > condition, IEventReceiver< TAuthenticationToken > eventReceiver=null)
memberdef.name: SendAndWait< TCommand, TEvent >

briefdescription.para: Sends the provided command and waits until the specified condition is satisfied an event of TEvent

parameterdescription.para: The TCommand to send.
A delegate to be executed over and over until it returns the TEvent that is desired, return null to keep trying.
If provided, is the IEventReceiver<TAuthenticationToken> that the event is expected to be returned on.

memberdef.argsstring: (Action< TMessage > handler, Type targetedType, bool holdMessageLock=true)
memberdef.name: RegisterHandler< TMessage >

briefdescription.para: Register an event or command handler that will listen and respond to events or commands.
Register an event or command handler that will listen and respond to events or commands.
Register an event handler that will listen and respond to all events.
Receives a ICommand<TAuthenticationToken> from the command bus.
Receives an IEvent<TAuthenticationToken> from the event bus.

Sets the IMessageWithAuthenticationToken<TAuthenticationToken>.AuthenticationToken, IMessage.CorrelationId, IMessage.OriginatingFramework to "Built-In" and adds a value of "Built-In" to the IMessage.Frameworks if not already done so

Locates a suitable ICommandValidator<TAuthenticationToken,TCommand> to validate the provided command and validates the provided command if one is located Calls PrepareCommand<TCommand> Checks if the provided command is required to be processed Locates a single command handler for the provided command

simplesect.para: False if a suitable ICommandValidator<TAuthenticationToken,TCommand> is located and the provided command fails validation, False if no command handler is found but the command isn't required to be handled, True otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Publishes the provided command on the command bus.
Publishes the provided commands on the command bus.

An in process command bus (ICommandPublisher<TAuthenticationToken> and ICommandReceiver<TAuthenticationToken>) event bus (IEventPublisher<TAuthenticationToken> and IEventHandler<TAuthenticationToken,TTarget,TEvent>) as well as a IEventHandlerRegistrar and ICommandHandlerRegistrar that requires no networking.

parameterdescription.para: The Type of the authentication token.
